title: The useful formula here is: $${cos}^{2\left(\theta\right)}=\frac{1+cos\left(2\theta\right)}{2}$$ and $${sin}^{\theta}=\frac{1-cos\left(2\theta\right)}{2}$$
Using the sin formula above, rewrite $${cos}^{4\left(x\right)}$$ as $$\left(\frac{1+cos\left(2x\right)}{2}\right)^2$$
Use the cosine formula $${cos}^{2\left(2x\right)}$$ and $${cos}^{3\left(2x\right)}$$ after expanding the numerator and multiplying together from earlier. Simplify using algebra.
